description.narrative: U.S. Department of Commerce, National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA): Implementation of the Global Ocean Observing System (GOOS) and the ARGO Array of profiling Floats in the Southwest Pacific Ocean. The Secretariat of the Pacific Regional Environment Programme (SPREP), through the Pacific Islands Global Ocean Observing System (PI-GOOS) supports the implementation of Argo in the South Pacific Region through maintenance of current agreement with Pacific Island State to operate profiling floats within Exclusive Economic Zones (presently 12) and works to expand the participation of SPREP Member States in Argo. The SEREAD (Scientific Educational Resources and Experience Associated with the Deployment of Argo profiling floats in the South Pacific Ocean) Program instructs teachers and teacher trainers on oceanographic sciences for implementation in education curricula to improve the understanding of ocean and atmospheric sciences in order to improve the uptake and use of data, information and products being generated by the Program.
